channel.title: What Operating System..?
channel.description:
Well, I've decided to get Linux.. I'm over Windows XP. And, I want to try it too see if I like it.
My school computers have it, but a variation of operating systems, one has Kubuntu, the other Ubuntu, etc.
I can download it now if I'd want to, but I don't know what one to download... And, all my cards and stuff are for Windows, my graphics card (ATI) is windows, my sound card or whatever is Gigabyte Technology... I can get software I need just my cards....
So, what should I get? At the moment I'm thinking Kubuntu.

item.title: What Operating System..?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

On another topic

sudo gnome huh

You can switch between KDE, GNOME, and XFCE after you downloaded/installed an *buntu.

item.title: What Operating System..?

item.description:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:1, topic:123675”]Well, I’ve decided to get Linux… I’m over Windows XP. And, I want to try it too see if I like it.

My school computers have it, but a variation of operating systems, one has Kubuntu, the other Ubuntu, etc.

I can download it now if I’d want to, but I don’t know what one to download…
And, all my cards and stuff are for Windows, my graphics card (ATI) is windows, my sound card or whatever is Gigabyte Technology…
I can get software I need just my cards…

So, what should I get?
At the moment I’m thinking Kubuntu.[/quote]

Get Kubuntu. Doesn’t matter, you can just sudo GNOME.
